Class MaxHeap<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • MaxHeap<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<E>

    public class MaxHeap<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<E>
    A class that acts like a max heap but can only store maximum of 7 elements

      • getCount

        public int getCount(int index)
        Returns:
        the amount of the element with the given index

      • getMode

        public int getMode()
        Returns:
        the mode of the heap. Mode is the most repeated element's amount

      • getModeElement

        public E getModeElement()
        Returns:
        the element which has the mode of the heap. If there are more than one elements, the last found one is returned.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true if heap has no elements, false if it has elements

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Returns:
        true if the heap has exactly 7 elements, false if it does not

      • contains

        public boolean contains(E element)
        Parameters:
        element - is the element that will be searched inside the heap
        Returns:
        true if the element is found, false if not

      • printArray

        public void printArray()
        Prints the heap in an array form

      • peek

        public E peek()
        Returns:
        the data of the very first element in the heap

      • merge

        public void merge(MaxHeap<E> other)
        Merges the other heap with the current heap. If the size becomes 7, doesnt add the remaining elements.
        Parameters:
        other - is the heap that will be merged to the current heap

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
        Compares another heap with re current heap. If the current heap's first element's data is bigger, return a value bigger than 0, if not returns a value smaller than 0, if equal, returns 0.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<E>

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the first element's data in the heap in a string form to represent the heap
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • offer

        public boolean offer(E element)
        Adds a new element to the heap. If the element already exists, increments its amount. If the element didnt use to exist, adds it as the last element then fixes the order of the heap.
        Parameters:
        element - is the element that will be added.
        Returns:
        true if adds, false if not

      • poll

        public E poll()
        Removes the first element from the heap and then fixes the order.
        Returns:
        the removed element's data

      • search

        public int search(E element)
        Searches for an element in the heap
        Parameters:
        element - is the element that will be searched in the array.
        Returns:
        the index of the searched element

      • remove

        public E remove(int largestNo)
        Removes the n'th largest element from the heap.
        Parameters:
        largestNo - is n
        Returns:
        the removed element, null if nothing is removed.

        public MaxHeapIterator iterator()
        Returns:
